This is a real disapointment. I dont understand why Eddie has to make this kind of pictures, is he on a contract that makes him do this kind of b-movies ? It was painful from the beginning to the end, i´m gonna forget about the movie as soon as i can. But i had to write it down, sorry.

reviews.review_title: Was surprised that I actually liked this movie.
reviews.content: I was surprised that I actually liked this movie. I think it started when Randy Quaid came out as the antiquated robot bodyguard. I know this movie flopped but it is definately worth a watch. The movie is witty, surprisingly action packed, and all and all a intresting story line that throws you for a loop at the end.

reviews.review_title: I was pleasantly surprised for ONE reason...
reviews.content: After hearing all of the negative buzz about this flick, I rented it myself because I just HAD to see how bad this was. And, while I admit that it's a definite bomb, I found myself enjoying it. Why is that? It's not 2001: A Space Travesty. That Leslie Nielsen vehicle is not only by far the worst sci-fi comedy ever conceived, but in the running for the most godawful movie ever created. If that movie were put into a time capsule for future generations to find, it would suggest a race of total jackasses. Pluto Nash, however, only suggests childish filmmakers, which is quite welcome after all of the heavy, serious fare we've seen lately. So to all of you knocking this movie because it's not funny, it's not interesting, or whatever, why not rent a copy of 2001: A Space Travesty? I guarantee you that Pluto Nash will feel like Gladiator after the unrelenting 90 minutes of hell that lie in wait for you. In this respect, I feel Pluto Nash has been unfairly criticized.

reviews.review_title: Shoot me if you must, but I liked the movie.
reviews.content: Ok, let's face it, it's not an Academy Award winner, but Pluto Nash was a fun movie (catchy theme music too).  I can't believe all the bashing this movie has taken, for a goofy fun movie...lighten up people and enjoy.  Pluto Nash may not be Gone with the Wind, but it's also not Dude Where's my Car :-)

I bought the movie, after not seeing it in movie theaters. I thought it would be nice to have a Eddie Murphy and a Sci-Fi flick in one, being that those are two of my favriote movie types. I was sort of disapointed. I mean for one, the cast did an ok job, nothing specail. There were some good scenes and side-stories, but rather few. I mean the main plot really sucked, and it was a waist of specail talented actors, if not for a few delightful scenes I won't spoil for you.In absolute terms, this movie has made the largest financial loss of any movie to date, with a budget of $100 million and a total US gross of $4.41 million (total loss, $95.59 million). Which is why it cost me so much to buy on VHS.Oh well...

Which came first Independence Day or The Adventures of Pluto Nash? Independence Day was released six years before Pluto Nash. The connection between the two? James Rebhorn appeared in both. Seeing him looking younger in Pluto Nash than he did in ID added to my sense that Pluto Nash was a late 80s or early 90s film. It just has that look and feel to it. Pluto Nash resembles 1986's Howard the Duck more than its 2002 brethren Star Wars Episode II, Lord of the Rings II, Spider Man, or MIB II (which also included Rosario Dawson). The reason that Pluto Nash seems out of place is that its genesis came in the mid-80s. For some reason, no one stuck a fork in it. Going into production 15 years (in 2000) after its conception is odd to say the least. The mid-80s were not the early 2000s. What might have been entertaining in 1985 wasn't so in 2002. The 80s were just a very different time. Pluto Nash has such an 80s feel to it that I distinctly remember watching it repeatedly on HBO while in my apartment. The thing is, I had moved from that apartment in 1988. Freaky false memory, huh? Other 80s features of Pluto Nash are its dialog, sets, coloration, and special effects. Cheesy is the word that describes the general feel of Pluto Nash. What perplexes me is that this movie cost about $125 million dollars. I could not see anything or any combination of things in Pluto Nash that should have added up to $125 million. A fifth of that? A fourth of that? Maybe. Maybe Eddie Murphy made a killing with his salary. Maybe Warner Brothers worked with the federales to funnel cash to the NSA, and Pluto Nash really cost only $1 million to make. The extra $124 million would buy a lot of flash drives.As cheesy and unbelievably expensive as this movie is, it is still moderately entertaining. Eddie Murphy (who hit his stride in the 80s and probably peaked just before this movie) is an entertainer through and through. I can't think of many roles where I haven't felt good from watching him work. (Delirious is one funny standup performance with him in that red leather jumpsuit and all.) Rosario Dawson spent a lot of the movie doing nothing but looking cute, and she excelled in that. (She's another performer who seldom disappoints.) Randy Quaid made a good performance as an outdated android. The part didn't have much depth or opportunities, but he scored some of the movie's best lines. All of the humor in Pluto Nash was subtle. Very subtle, but there nonetheless.Pluto Nash is a good movie to have on as background stimulus. Maybe at a family holiday gathering when the movie is secondary.

The problem with Pluto Nash wasn't if it is good or bad.   The problem (at least for the studio) is that this never was going to be a movie that could make $100 million, yet they green lit the spending for it.  Even with BOFFO worldwide and video sales, this will probably not even get within making half of their money back now.  One wonders what the producers were thinking, considering everything going against this movie:  1) Too goofy a title to be a summer blockbuster, 2) Eddie Murphy (other than Dr Doolittle & Nutty Professor movies) hasn't been a box office draw in 10 years), 3) I never saw a TV ad for this that I can recall, so, obviously the studio thought it wasn't even worth promoting once it got made.   This is really this summer "Anti-Fat Greek Wedding" (which was made for $5 million and will make $100 million, vs. the other way around).

reviews.review_title: I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this movie!
reviews.content:
Pluto Nash is not for the brainiac in us.I did find it an amusing and playful movie that I would recommend seeing.I read the reviews in the papers and on the web and I can tell you that the critics who get paid are wrong again. They seem to have gotten their noses bent out of joint by not being allowed to screen the movie before everyone else.For those of us writing reviews on the web, we seem to be a confused lot. Half of us like it and half don't. I went expecting a B grade Sci-Fi with cheesy Eddie Murphy jokes and enjoyed myself throughly. It's actually one of the better movies I've seen recently, believe it or not, mostly because it's not pretending to be something it's not, and then failing miserably.
I wouldn't recommend this one for the kids, not that there is much sex/violence, but more for the fact that the humour is just stuff that kids won't find funny. (I must be feeling my age. :)Don't go to this movie if you want great Sci-fi, don't go if you want great comedy, but I recommend it for those of you who just want to be entertained without a lot of thought!

Advance comments would have you believe this is some horridhybrid of Holy Man and 2001:A Space Travesty. It's actually a pleasant action movie with comic tones, sly touches and a nicetwist.. The trailer doesn't do it justice. I mainly went to see thepairing of Eddie Murphy and John Cleese, two comic geniuseswith different approaches.  I suppose if Jack Black was the star itwould be hailed as a comic masterpiece by those who thinkhearing the word "Malkovich" over and over again denotes genius. A good Saturday afternoon escapist feature and I did not hear the "Uranus" joke so take that to mean what you will.

reviews.review_title: Far better than most make out
reviews.content: Having seen watched this film last night, with a preconception of an all out dodgy sci-fi comedy I was pleasantly surprised to find that 'Pluto Nash' was actually a good movie. Much better than I originally expected and far better than some of these other reviews make out. The jokes aren't all that crude, the acting isn't too bad, and there are some good action sequences. The visual effects and sets are very good. Very Bladerunner/Total Recall in style. If you haven't got anything to do for about 90 minutes, I suggest going to see this enjoyable futuristic, comedy romp. It will have you laughing, for all the right reasons.

reviews.review_title: A Movie That Is Ahead Of Its Time.....
reviews.content: Feels like a simple case of "POLITICS AS USUAL",  when it comes to this movie.  Looks like the critics and the "REALLY SENSITIVE" took this flick way too personal,  because the only thing I see with this movie is teh "BALANCE OF POWER / CONTROL BASED ON ETHNICS".A good movie,  with an odd premise,  but funny just the same.  I would easily closely compare this one to the likes of "THE FIFTH ELEMENT, DEMOLITION MAN or TERMINATOR SERIES".All of these movies have rediculous, or unbelievable subject matter, but entertaining just the same.Timing also played a big part in this movie.  I truly believe that had this movie been released at the right time, it could have made all the difference.The entire cast and crew were GREAT!  I especially enjoyed the little things, (details that mattered),  which laced the entire movie together.The only thing I see here is that prevous movies Eddie Murphy starred seemed to shoot for a younger audience, where as this movie was set in the future,  it used a number of actors from an older age group.  (That is probably what attracted me).I guess if its all about the bottom line, ($$$ Cha-Ching $$$),  one must be more aware of the market they are targeting by using newer names (perhaps),  while also being aware who has the power or control in the movie.Its all good!  All about "Entertainmant"..... (Just a movie).  Some day there might become a time when our society, as a whole, can actually complete a movie that would meet or exceed the sensitivities of at least the majority of its viewers.;<)

This was a great movie.  I don't know why everyone gave it a harsh review. It had action and comedy, a perfect mix.  The robot was hilarious.  The jokes went great along the story.  A masterpiece waiting to be watch. 10/10.

Just watched this movie last night, interested in seeing how it turned out. I had heard from plenty of other folks that it was an enjoyable flick; they were right.  Everything about this movie is neat, including the acting, sound design, production quality, cinematography.  I think some folks just expected more, and were disappointed.  Usually I'm pretty critical about films, but this one worked well.  Is it another Godfather?  Not even close, but I give it 8/10.  And I'll watch it again.

reviews.review_title: They sure know how to bury a film.
reviews.content: Before this movie even came out it was buried.  But I thought a movie directed by a seasoned director like Ron Underwood, and starring Eddie Murphy couldn´t be all that bad, and it wasn´t. Someone put the word out, and it´s a shame. Eddie is in good form, and he has the capable Randy Quaid in a funny comedic role, and the film has some very good action sequences set to a pretty good score. I think Eddie is one of those special actors who if puut in most any film (except Harlem Nights, sorry) the film will be interesting. I think TAOPN was going to be a franchise film, and it´s too bad we didn´t get to see Eddie play this character again. 2.5 stars out of 4.

zi love Sci Fi and Cheesey sci Fi...The Hit1. THe technology and setting was great...They spent money on effect 2. the battles were pretty good..I like the laser bulletsthe Miss...1. I don't know, it hurts for me to see a man who is very funny, just not be funny in this movie, I really think they told Eddie to add lib the whole movie...the other actors looked as if they just waited for him to add lib then did there lines..it was just bad2. the story was ok, but I just did not like the twist in the end..thought it was cheesy
great sci fi setting but little else 5/10

reviews.review_title: One Of My Favorite Fallback Movies Of All Time
reviews.content: I can not tell you how many times I have watched this movie! is it Eddie Murphy of old (when he had to prove himself?) No! (do you really think an actor should limit himself to what people want him to be?) Is it Eddie Murphy entertaining himself? well... it quite possibly could be! in any case, stop looking at his movies for what he used to be, and appreciate the man for what he is!! this movie was brilliant in a lot of different ways that simply are not "Eddie Murphy" I for one am glad he got rid of that old personification and made movies like this and Coming to America! (I think the world is much richer with them) and it's marvelous to watch an actor grow! (even if you don't think its what he should be growing into)

reviews.review_title: Not a great film, but not bad, either
reviews.content: I don't know why this film has been getting such bad buzz. It's the standard "wise-cracking protagonist on the run from the mob, trying to get to the bottom of things" plot, no more hackneyed than any number of other films which audiences have responded favorably to. It's got an amiable performance from Eddie Murphy, plus amusing support from Randy Quaid, Luis Guzman, and John Cleese. And, even though they're given little to do, it's good to see Peter Boyle, Burt Young and Pam Grier working. I though the cluttered design of the film, which reminded me a bit of Matt Groening's "Futurama", was well done, and I was pleasantly surprised that the design team and special effects team got most, but not all, of the sci-fi-geek details right (they still included an audible explosion in a vacuum). All in all, it's not a great movie, maybe not even a good one, but it's certainly not a bad one.

reviews.review_title: The sets, the goofiness, the lines, the story are all very good.
reviews.content: I watched this movie on TV on demand and thoroughly enjoyed it. Eddie Murphy, as usual, was excellent and the rest of the cast was just as good. I loved the sets, the goofiness, the lines, the story. Since I found myself wanting to re watch the movie I bought the DVD and the movie now stands on my shelf, next to my other favorites. Critics can be wrong. For example, back in the 1950s, "Imitation of Life", now recognized as a cinematographic masterpiece, was unanimously panned by the critics! This is just one example. Personally, I make it a point never to read them before watching a film. Instead, I check out the director, the cast and maybe the story. If I know neither director nor cast I use my own critical judgment based on the story, what my movie - savvy friends say and a general feel based on trailers. I might read the critics after seeing a film to see who I agree with or rather, who agrees with me. By unanimously panning The Adventures of Pluto Nash the critics have committed another Great Critic Blunder. The movie is really very good.

I saw this film in a second hand shop, and knowing that it had acquired poor reviews I wanted to see what constituted a 'bad film'. Well, the film has a very polished look about it. Although some of the moon scenes had a Total Recall look to them. The background artists were quite stilted and didn't look at all 'natural'. Back to the film. There was not much to the film. Characterisations were very simplistic, and the 'robots' were very curious in their presentation. It was quite a violent film, and what there was did not appear as comedic violence. One of the villains was especially ugly in a fashion which I suspect was comedic - cross eyes, curious gate etc. Murphy didn't add anything at all to a fairly limp script, and the Nash character was hard to pin down. There were a number of car chases 'on the moon', one featuring John Cleese, but any comedic angle to this went over my head. The end was very light - seeming to lack any sense of threat/urgency/difficult job well done etc. All in all, this was a poor film with what seemed high production costs but had neither any sense of originality, urgency or character empathy. All in all, it just seems boring.

Everyone complaining about this movie is a tool of the system, mouthing sound bites they heard somewhere else.  In fact, this movie is a lot better than many recent box office hits (incl. other Eddie Murphy movies).  I guess "moderately entertaining" ain't enough for H'wood when it costs 100 mil, but there are many, many examples more deserving of the stinkbomb rep PLUTO NASH got.  And most of them cost more.

Hrmmm, just about there worse movie ive ever seen... i dont have much to say about it, but i couldnt wait to get out of the cinemas, only reason i stayed till the end was because i was hoping somthing "interesting" and "good" might happen... but did it? no if you want a comedy dont see this.

reviews.review_title: Lunar Las Vegas With Fun Science Fiction
reviews.content: Fun theme music and some playful thoughts about life in the future (the Lunar Grand  Hotel, instant plastic surgery, the hillarious [sic] new face of money, and so on)  punctuate this action adventure. Pluto Nash (Eddie Murphy) is the owner of a nightclub  on the moon which has apparently been settled Las Vegas style by the time the movie  begins. His adventures occur as he goes about protecting his interests and his existence  from the underworld figures who are trying to muscle in on his turf. Dina Lake (Rosario  Dawson, also seen in Men In Black II) makes for an attractive cohort. Bruno (Randy  Quaid) is an unexpectedly sympathetic android character. Some will appreciate the  rather enjoyable exterior scenes of lunar habitats and Earthrise moonscapes. It's just a  movie, folks, but if you're in the right mood, it's entertaining.

reviews.review_title: I thought Pluto Nash was a great movie!
reviews.content: I honestly don't know why all these critic "SNOB'S" get listened to.? Judge the movie on your own! Let no one tell you how you should feel about The Adventures of Pluto Nash. I Honestly thought it was unique, light hearted, inventive, yes a bit silly, but SO what? It was a lot of fun and it had a very good ending. I think all of you out there giving this movie such a hard time need to stop taking yourselves entirely to seriously. Lighten up!:) I have read a lot of comments, and reviews on movies such as Megaforce. This movie was the same as Pluto Nash. fun, Unique, and after all is said and done light hearted. Like Puto Nash it had a great if a little over the top story line. You should look up some of the reviews. However I suggest you see the movie for yourself first. Remember It was made In what 1979-80? movie technology wasn't quite where it it today (except for the Lucas's and Spielburg's) of the world, but they did the best with what they had. I Just believe most of these movie critics are just venting their own frustration at having nothing better to do. So there being as mean as they possibly can.
The movie is fun and funny. Is it award winning no. But it's better than the ratings I've seen

Eddie Murphy is one of the best comedic actors but this movie is simply horrible! Hey gang! Have you been searching high and low for that movie that makes you don't care about the plot, the people in it or that you forget entirely ten seconds after the credits roll? If so, this is the movie for you! Watch only in extreme curiosity, or if you are into camp, which i barely think this is.
